Functions

importTypesForDocument(\SimpleXMLElement $doc) : \lyquidity\xml\schema\SchemaTypes

Call to load types for an XML instance document The current SchemaTypes instance will be returned but the same instance can be retrieve any time by calling SchemaTypes::getInstance()

Parameters
NameTypeDescription
$doc\SimpleXMLElement

A document

Returns
TypeDescription
\lyquidity\xml\schema\SchemaTypes
Details
Package
Default  
initializeLog() : void

Call this function to initialize a default logger.

This function does not need to be called if the Lyquidity XPath 2.0 or Lyquidity XBRL library bootstrap functions have been called as both these initialize a suitable logger.

Details
Package
Default  
qname(array | string $value, array | string $name = null, boolean $noPrefixIsNoNamespace = false, \lyquidity\xml\Exception $castException = null, \lyquidity\xml\Exception $prefixException = null) : \lyquidity\xml\QName

Generate a QName instance.

Parameters
NameTypeDescription
$valuearray | string

can be a QName, an array or a string. If a string it will be the namespace of the value of $name or a Clark notation. If an array then it will be an array representation of the QName.

$namearray | string

Can be an array of prefix/namespace key/value pairs or it can be the prefixed local name

$noPrefixIsNoNamespaceboolean

If no prefix is found then there will be no namespace if this is true

$castException\lyquidity\xml\Exception

In case there is a cast exception

$prefixException\lyquidity\xml\Exception

In case there is a prefix exception

Returns
TypeDescription
\lyquidity\xml\QName
Throws
ExceptionDescription
\lyquidity\xml\Exception
Details
Package
Default  
qnameClarkName(string $clarkname) : null | \lyquidity\xml\QName

Converts a string in the clark notation format to a QName instance Does not handle clark names with prefix
